intro: Stenocephalum jucundum, commonly known as the Happyhead plant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
